title: 111_s1556
content:
The "Veteran Voting Support Act of 2009" recognizes the service of veterans and aims to provide voter registration assistance through the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide a mail voter registration application form to veterans seeking enrollment in the Department of Veterans Affairs health care system and to those already enrolled in case of changes in enrollment status or address. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide voter registration assistance to veterans, similar to the assistance provided by the Veterans Administration. Completed voter registration forms will be accepted and transmitted to the appropriate State election official by the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must ensure voter registration information and assistance provided does not influence political preference or party allegiance. Completed forms must be transmitted to the State election official within specific timeframes. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must ensure voter registration information and assistance provided does not influence political preference or party allegiance. No information related to voter registration can be used for any purpose other than voter registration. Enforcement includes providing notice of violations to the facility director or the secretary. The Director or Secretary must respond to a notice of violation within 20 days. If the violation is not corrected within 90 days, the Attorney General and Election Assistance Commission can be notified. The Attorney General has the authority to take action. The Attorney General can take legal action in court for declaratory or injunctive relief to enforce this section or section 4. SEC. 4. ASSISTANCE WITH ABSENTEE BALLOTS. Each director of a VA health care facility must assist veterans with absentee voting, including providing information, applications, and working with election officials for proper transmission. Nonpartisan organizations can provide voter registration assistance at Department of Veterans Affairs health care facilities, with restrictions on timing and notification. Election officials must also offer assistance at these facilities. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must allow election officials to provide voting information to veterans at VA facilities, including voter registration services. Voting information includes nonpartisan details on voting processes and resources. The Department of Veterans Affairs must allow State and local election officials to offer nonpartisan voter registration services at VA facilities, with reasonable restrictions on time and notice requirements. SEC. 7. ANNUAL REPORT ON COMPLIANCE.

The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit an annual report to Congress on compliance with the Act, including the number of veterans served, voter registration assistance provided, and resolution of violations alleged in written notices.

SEC. 8. RULES OF CONSTRUCTION. SEC. 8. RULES OF CONSTRUCTION.

This section clarifies that the Act does not provide individual benefits to veterans and does not override certain existing laws related to voting rights and accessibility.
